content:
MarkupProperty Class

In this Article

Abstract class that provides a property description to be used while writing to markup which encapsulates access to properties and their values.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class MarkupProperty

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • MarkupProperty

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

A property is either represented as a string or a list of items.

If the property can be represented as a string, IsComposite is false.

If IsComposite is true, the property is a list of items.

Properties summary

Attributes

When overridden in a derived class, gets the attributes associated with this MarkupProperty.
DependencyProperty

When overridden in a derived class, gets the DependencyProperty identifier for the markup property if the property is implemented as a dependency property
IsAttached

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty is an attached DependencyProperty.
IsComposite

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty is a composite property.
IsConstructorArgument

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents a constructor argument.
IsContent

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents direct content of a collection.
IsKey

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents the key used by the MarkupObject to store the item in a dictionary.
IsValueAsString

When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents text which is passed to a type converter to create an instance of the property or if a constructor should be used.
Items

When overridden in a derived class, gets the items that make up the value of this property.
Name

When overridden in a derived class, gets a name that is used for diagnostics and error reporting.
PropertyDescriptor

When overridden in a derived class, gets the PropertyDescriptor for the markup property.
PropertyType

When overridden in a derived class, gets the CLR type of the property.
StringValue

When overridden in a derived class, gets the string value of this MarkupProperty.
TypeReferences

When overridden in a derived class, gets the set of types that this MarkupProperty will reference when it serializes its value as a string.
Value

When overridden in a derived class, gets the current value of this MarkupProperty.

Properties

  • Attributes

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the attributes associated with this MarkupProperty.

    public abstract System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection Attributes { get; }

    Property Value

    • AttributeCollection

      The collection of attributes.

  • DependencyProperty

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the DependencyProperty identifier for the markup property if the property is implemented as a dependency property

    public virtual System.Windows.DependencyProperty DependencyProperty { get; }

    Property Value

    • DependencyProperty

      The dependency property identifier.

    Remarks

    The default behavior returns null.

  • IsAttached

    When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty is an attached DependencyProperty.

    public virtual bool IsAttached { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the property is an attached DependencyProperty; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default behavior is to return false.

    When IsAttached is true, DependencyProperty is not null and PropertyDescriptor can be null, but is not required to be.

  • IsComposite

    When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty is a composite property.

    public virtual bool IsComposite { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true is this property is a composite property; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default behavior is to return false.

    If IsComposite is false, the property can be represented as a string and Value and StringValue are valid to use.

    If IsComposite is true, the property is one or more items and Items is valid to use.

  • IsConstructorArgument

    When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents a constructor argument.

    public virtual bool IsConstructorArgument { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this property represents a constructor argument; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default behavior is return false.

    When IsConstructorArgument is true, PropertyDescriptor and DependencyProperty are both null.

    XAML only uses IsConstructorArgument for representing the constructor arguments of instances of MarkupExtension. See Markup Extensions and WPF XAML.

  • IsContent

    When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents direct content of a collection.

    public virtual bool IsContent { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the property represents direct content; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default behavior is to return false.

    When IsContent is true, PropertyDescriptor and DependencyProperty are both null.

    Dictionaries are included when determining whether this MarkupProperty represents direct content.

  • IsKey

    When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents the key used by the MarkupObject to store the item in a dictionary.

    public virtual bool IsKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this property represents a key; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default behavior is to return false.

    When IsKey is true, PropertyDescriptor and DependencyProperty are null.

    XAML will use the identified property as an x:Key attribute.

  • IsValueAsString

    When overridden in a derived class, determines whether this MarkupProperty represents text which is passed to a type converter to create an instance of the property or if a constructor should be used.

    public virtual bool IsValueAsString { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true, if this MarkupProperty represents a string; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default behavior is to return false.

    When IsValueAsString is true, PropertyDescriptor and DependencyProperty are both null.

    If the property is provided through Properties and IsValueAsString is true, it will be the only property the type will provide.

  • Items

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the items that make up the value of this property.

    public abstract System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Markup.Primitives.MarkupObject> Items { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<MarkupObject>

      The items that make up the value of this property.

    Remarks

    If the property is not an enumeration, only one item will be returned.

    If the property is an enumeration, or enumerable, all the items will be returned.

    At least one item is always returned, because MarkupObject will not create a MarkupProperty for properties with no items.

  • Name

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a name that is used for diagnostics and error reporting.

    public abstract string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The identifier property name.

    Remarks

    A serializer should not use this value. It should use the PropertyDescriptor and/or DependencyProperty instead.

  • PropertyDescriptor

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the PropertyDescriptor for the markup property.

    public virtual System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor PropertyDescriptor { get; }

    Property Value

    • PropertyDescriptor

      The property descriptor.

    Remarks

    The default behavior returns null.

  • PropertyType

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the CLR type of the property.

    public abstract Type PropertyType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The CLR type.

  • StringValue

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the string value of this MarkupProperty.

    public abstract string StringValue { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The string value.

  • TypeReferences

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the set of types that this MarkupProperty will reference when it serializes its value as a string.

    public abstract System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Type> TypeReferences { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable<Type>

      The set of types.

    Remarks

    TypeReferences enables a serializer to ensure that the de-serializer has enough information to convert references to these type from the string representations.

  • Value

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the current value of this MarkupProperty.

    public abstract object Value { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The current value.
